reviewText:
A very refreshing and different spin on the golf vidoe game genre. Bit of a graphics hog but Hb Studios is still hevily invested in the community and keeps tweaking, updating and optimizing this wonderful golf game. If you like the feel of a weekend golfer type game without all the commercialism and unrealistic buffs and boosts then this is your game. Plus it comes with a nice course creator for those that enjoy spending their time making player created content.
The swing mechanic is done very well (sorry no 3 click here) as it was heavily worked on and tested during Aplha, Beta and Early Release. It' probably the best thing I enjoy about the game. It requires some time investment to get used to it but that is what makes it great. You'll find plenty of rewarding moments when you pull of some fantastic putts and shots.
HB Studios has done some interesting and different takes on multiplayer and the social aspect of the game but that is what makes it refreshing and fun. You'll find some negative feedback but kudos to HB Studios for not trying to please everyone and sticking to their fundamental precepts about the game. If you do decide to buy take the time to read through the forums and give them some constructive feedback as to how they may improve the game. While you might not get what you wish for you will at least be heard and considered. I can't thank them enough as I and many others have been waiting for decades for a golfing game like this.

Thanks again HB Studios!
voteText: 10 of 17 people (59%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For the first release of this game this is amazing. Many have been waiting for a new golf game for PC and the wait is over.

GRAPHICS
Graphics are good, but the early release lacks advanced graphics settings so the quality is limited at the moment. With a bit of anti aliasing it would look great. Not sure if its just me but the sky and trees often 'flicker' during animations and transitions but small things like that are to be expected during early access and its by no means gamebreaking. Trees are reasonably good - a bit more variety would be good but they look nice.

EDIT: Flickering seems to be gone.

GAMEPLAY
The gameplay is heaps of fun, but I think it might get boring quickly as it's a little too easy. This release lacks difficulty settings and the current difficulty can be mastered in minutes. I'm not sure about the putting - judging power is very hard as there's almost no indication of the required power, it's just guesswork. But in saying that I feel that the difficult putting helps to make the game a bit more challenging. I have only used a controller which makes short work of hitting the ball. I feel that there needs to be something else in the swing mechanics - timing maybe. It's just a bit too easy to hit a perfect shot nearly every time. The physics is excellent - the ball spins as you would expect and interacts well with different surfaces.

COURSE CREATOR
I have spent 3-4 hours in the course creator and so far it's great. I don't think there is an option to start blank (without generated holes) which would be great. It lags a little every time you make a change to the course which gets annoying - especially when adding trees. The edge of farways can sometimes get a little funky for no reason but it can be fixed with a bit of playing around. Other than that it's great. I've had a lot of fun playing peoples creations and there's heaps of variety in the user-created courses.

SUGGESTIONS
One thing really lacking at the moment is customization and I'm sure it's coming in the future. You can currently choose between a few golfers and change the colour of your clothes which is fine for now. Hopefully there will be a store of some kind where I can purchase clubs, balls, clothing, etc. with money I've earned playing tours. Using the Imperial system is killing me - I can't find a setting to change to metric (tell me if there is one) which makes it hard for me to replicate local courses in the creator. I'd like to see an XP system implemented to increase your ability as you level up/gain XP.

Overall, The Golf Club is an excellent golf game and it's only going to get better as new updates are released. Thank you for filling hole that was left after Tiger Woods Online shut down.

reviewText:
I don't play golf in real life, but love golf games, go figure. I have been playing this since early access and loving it. Great graphics, an intuitive putting system, and a real challenge. The latest patch has really optimized the game for PC and although I thought I would care less, I am digging the new handicap system. The course designer brings an unlimited number of courses to play on, and although it can be hard to sort through them all, there are plenty of web resources out there to help you do that.

My only slight criticisms would be chipping needs some refinement, and it would be cool if during tournaments wind was consistent for everyone.

If you like golf on the PC and games that are easy to learn but hard to master, do not hesitate to pick this one up.

reviewText:
UPDATE as of 12/30/14

I jumped on this game with a friend the other day and I really felt the need to update my review. They have really improved this game. The mechanics are so much better than the last time I played, it is astounding.

The multiplayer is still a little weird, but it is playable.

$30-$35 is pretty steep still, but if you can snag this game when it's on sale, it would be a good buy.

***********************Previous Review Below*******************************

UPDATE .51: As of this update, They have added turn based multiplayer which is a step in the right direction and I applaud them for this action. When your friend hits, you are still seeing them a few seconds late but I have hopes that they will improve this.

The only thing keeping my reccomendation a no is really the price tag.

I think once the ingame issues are ironed out, it will be worth the $30 tag. But as of right now, it is not.

***********************Previous Review Below*******************************

At this state, I would not buy it unless you are wanting to play this game by yourself.

My biggest reason that I am not recommending this game is becuase of the lack of structured multiplayer. I bought this game for that one purpose and I feel let down. The multiplayer it currently has, has you select your friends that are currently playing that course and that will allow you to see them on your scorecard. From there, you go into the game and your friend hits the ball and about 10-20 seconds later, you see their ball fly after they hit. It is very hard to Play a game with friends when you want to see their shots and want them to see yours as well. If you come from WGT, You know what I mean here. Your friend can finish the hole and move on to the next hole before you even tee off. It is not turn based which may be a positive if you don't like waiting but to me, I wanted to see my friends shoot.

PROS:
-Looks Great
-Swing style like tiger woods
-AWESOME course creator

CONS:
-Lack of structured multiplayer
-Club/power/distance is off (ie 15% power with 100 ft putter will go 4 ft on flat green)
-Current courses seem very similar to eachother

Again, this is in its CURRENT state. May or may not change in the future.

reviewText: IMHO, there's a glitch with the game. As of this entry, that glitch has not been fixed. Not being able to complete my swing began after I upgraded to Windows 10. What I found worked in that situation where I couldn't complete my swing was, while still on the hole I was having problems completing my swing on I hit alt+enter, clicked inside the game window, then hit alt+enter again. This caused some artifacts to appear. Then I hit the escape key, clicked exit game, clicked accept, then, from the main menu I resumed the game, then I was able to complete my swing and continue play and didn't notice any more swing hang ups. Hope this helps.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Perspective on The Golf Club

This is just an opinion from a complete casual to sports games let alone golf.

Anyways, In it's current form, The Golf Club manages to still have a remarkable level of charm. It's menus and UI are ultra clean and the hole to hole commentary is my absolute favorite. It feels extremely relaxing while still satisfying. As far as the way other players and AI ghosts are implemented, I thought it was well done. The real time trails keep games moving at a quicker pace, and have enough visual cues to have me interested in the competition's play as much as my own. Those were the stand out positives for me.

Everything the game lacks feels like that's because the project is a work in progess. The characters lack any sort of gear customization outside of clothing, gloves, and shoes. I found it difficult on occasion to drive the ball as far as other players and for a novice player, I felt I was lacking neccessary instruction on how I could improve my shot distance and accuracy. I felt that I either hit the ball with too low a shot power percentage or at exactly 100%, even if that's not what I wanted. Maybe if I can't pick up on the visual measurement for shot power a meter could be implemented like in other golf games. The game also did not show a guess as to where the ball could land, but just an idea of where I was aiming. In conjunction with the scout camera, I actually liked the lack of extra graphics on the grass, but at the same time, some of my shots suffered due to a poor understanding of where I had really aimed the ball. The game lacked the female golfer model, facial customization, and the games graphics, while suitable, need a lot of work done in regards to vegetation, trees, and their shadowing.

All in all though, I felt that my purchase has already been justified if it helps the developers reach the next patch/update. I am excited in the future of this title, because with the lack of a new Tiger Woods game, a lot is riding on this game to fill a gap for me.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI have been looking for a decent golf game for quite some time, as I am a big fan of the Tiger Woods series on the consoles. Since I have not used a console since the Gamecube, I was waiting for a decent golfing title for PC. Which is sorely lacking. I am very glad this developer took the risk and made this title. So kudos to them. With that said, this is by no means a Tiger Woods Golf game clone, and that in some ways is a good thing, as this is aiming for ultra-realism. Lots of work needs to be done before this can go prime time, though. The course creation tool is a huge mess right now, and look forward to the finished product. The game itself is solid, the commentator is extremely polite (even after a 4-putt on a 3), and the swing mechanics are simple. Plenty of courses are available, and that gives big marks from me. Hopefully, this title will bite with other golfing fans, and gamers in general. With enough money, I am sure this game can go places.

reviewText:
When I first bought the game it suffered from major graphical glitches which impeded my ability to play on anything but the lowest settings, but it's seems they've updated it and I haven't had any problems since.

As far as the game goes, the courses people make online are amazing and at good graphics settings, the game is absolutely breathtaking.  There are infinite courses to play, making sure that you've always got something to keep ya coming back.  I haven't tried out the course designer extensively but it seems powerful and simple to use, making it possible to make any course you could imagine.

It's great fun playing with an Xbox 360 controller and local multiplayer is wonderful, I love having 1-3 friends over, passing the controller around and talking smack to each other.

As far as realistic golf simulation, what more can you expect from a computer game? It does a really good job of forcing you to consider elevation, terrain, wind, and other variables that can have a serious impact on your swing.  It's much more difficult than the Tiger Woods series and the golfing feels much more realistic.

As far a fun golf sim to play with your friends, this game hits the nail on the head. Buy it, have some friends over, pass around a few beers and the controller and have some fun on the links!

reviewText: The Golf Club is a game where you play golf. Thats it. But actuallly its not quite that simple. Yes, you play golf but its nothing like the PGA Tour games. All in all though, I felt that my purchase has already been justified if it helps the developers reach the next patch/update. I am excited in the future of this title, because with the lack of a new Tiger Woods game, a lot is riding on this game to fill a gap for me.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First impression had my GPU running pretty hard. 670gtx, 75 celcius, 38 fps. It'll get better but it is.... Unity... apparently. I was on the high settings so no real drama this early on.

But the golf. Ahhh... The golf.

Links 386. This is how far I go back in this genre so I can pretty well say I've been there, done that. Tried them all, even down to the Wii with my kids. Those bulbous heads and stupid haircuts really made me laugh. Really. This is *golf* and you look like an idiot!!

Oops... Sorry. I digress.

There's something very, very different about this golf sim. You need to actually plan and play your shots PROPERLY. Got that? PROPERLY.

There's no little swing indicators and clicky bits. There's no arbitrary line to STOP for maximum power". This sim does require a finesse of stroke and practise regime like nothing I've ever seen. It's nice.

If you're a must.have.line.to.click player this may not be for you. You've been warned.

But... but.... this is easy to grasp. Intuitive even.  (although much harder to master if you want that tricky fade around those trees on the 17th).

The visuals in this are nice and no doubt the GPU issues will chill a little as optimisations go in.  It is early access at time of writing so I'm not going to scream agghhhhhh with my extra power costs just yet.

The commentary is sublime despite an obvious repetiveness if you play badly for prolonged periods. It's sardonic
date: 19th hole humour if ever. "John" has obviously played many a round with many a weekend hack... and it shows. Some may be put off by it. It's down to how you perceive it.\n\nI like this game but I suspect it will wear thin quickly. The scores are just arbitrary numbers and the stroke play
recommended:
while intuitive is well... quite wrong. This is not 8-ball and yet I push vertical while I look at the green. I'm hoping some changes in the future might address this.

Worth waiting until final release if you're squeamish spending. A must for golfers with scorecard phobia out on the real course.

I'm sure casual golfers will find it pretty easy too - after a few rounds. It's not rocket science. Not on a computer anyway.

8.5/10 - gg"

reviewText: I've been playing PC golf games since Mean 18 back in 1986. This is a game I'd give a meh" to more than  just Yes or a No
date: but considering the lack of development the last few months I'm giving it the thumbs down. That's mostly due to the launch condition of the game. There are some sins that should not be tolerated by the public and the launch of this game was abysmal.\n\nThe Golf Club is a pretty mediocre representation of golf with issues that have been around since it launched in early access - inconsistent swing meters
voteText: varying object qualities
helpfulPercent: iffy physics
votesHelpful: overpowered wind and a few other problems. Anyone who claims this is a "simulator" doesn't understand the meaning of the word. You can tweak your shot
votesTotal: but the shot mechancis themselves are uninteresting and (unfortunately for multiplayer) extremely easy to "cheat" with. Edging with the mouseswing is a common problem online and in virtually every match you'll run into someone who is using it to hit every shot dead straight.\n\nThe career mode was released later and is DLC
votesFunny: which didn't make me too happy considering the massive release problems. Customers should have gotten more for their loyalty and patience.\n\nThat doesn't mean that the game is totally horrid. If you're lucky enough that the game runs well for you
commentsCount: then you're less likely to run into the swing meter issues (they're often based on sudden frame rate drops). Get the right course at the right time of day and the game can be quite attractive. The course designer isn't as powerful as some
column16: but it's quite easy to use and the pregeneration of terrain is something that is a great idea. It's a Power to the People course designer and you'll see lots of them
column17: some of them quite clever.\n\nThe devs are hit and miss. They are not bad folks
column18: but they knew a lot of these problems existed and rushed the game out the door to match the console release (and it's quite obvious this is a console golf game first and foremost). So fixing obvious problems like the green grid not working or being able to retract your course from the public (if you accidentally published it) have gone lacking. The short game is another place in this that the game is abysmal - forget trying to hit half or three-quarter shots because the mechanics don't lend themselves to doing so. Some of these issues have been subsequently fixed. Some have not.\n\nThe post-December patch seems to have improved performance. They've stoped farting  around with trying to boost the user ratings of their own courses. In short
column19: they've made progress. This is the good part. However
column20: it's still not a simulation and there's no way I'm giving this a thumbs up because of the horribly botched release and months of inaction of their part.\n\nHowever
column21: the swing is still tempermental and relies on frame rate to achieve 100%. Turn the settings up and the swing meter goes wonky. And now there's too many really lousy courses to comb through
column22: so finding something worth playing has become an exercise in futility. What's worse is that you can't even provide any kind of decent feedback and to rate the course you still have to complete the round. Who wants to complete a round on a course that sucks? That's both the good and the bad part of having a designer that will spit out somewhat ready-made courses. You simply get an overabundance of stuff to choose from but then finding a good course is like looking for a needle in a haystack.\n\nPersonally
column23: I find that Perfect Golf simply "plays" a much better round of golf. Then again I'm partial to that Links 2003 style of approach to golf. YMMV but I'm glad this isn't the only PC golf game on the market.\n\nLong story short
column26: questionable development...equals thumbs down (or at least buy only on sale). I can't recommend this at full price."

reviewText:
Decent game but needs attention before I would recommend it.
The backswing and down swing are way to slow and can really throw your swing (mouse movements) off because of this, also is very hard to have control over how much power is put into each shot.
Not being able to move your shot aimer when zoomed down the hole is annoying and not being able to move your shot aimer with your mouse is quite annoying also. Putting can be really difficult when using a mouse.
The course editor could use some more basic functions of moving holes and tee's.

reviewText:
This is everything I want in a golf game but with one single glaring issue. Playing with the mouse it's nearly impossible to control power.

The core issue is feedback. Sure, you gauge the size of the backswing, but there's a lag moment after you start the swing where the animation updates. During this gap you will be pulling back on the mouse and seeing nothing happen, then suddenly you are at 100%.

Despite this glaring, house-on-fire design issue, I'm still giving this game a thumbs up because it's so good in nearly every other aspect. If they could just refine this single swing-power issue, my forehead would be grateful as I would no longer be smashing it into my desk repeatedly.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is very good and I highly recommend to anyone who likes golf or has played the EA Sports Tiger Woods Golf Series(Which has been canceled). The game is easy to learn but hard to master. And the replayability factor is incredible. The graphics are top notch but the large course size and quick loading times can lead to some lag issues during rounds. Also the course creator is easy to use and one can create a unique course to play in under a minute. The multiplayer concept seems great but has not been implemented yet. I would also recommend using a Windows Xbox 360 controller over the mouse and keyboard. Overall this game has tons of potential and I can't wait for the finished product. Buy now when it has the low price.
9.5/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nLet me start this review with a blunt statement; this game is not enjoyable to the ignorant. What I'm trying to say is that you have to have at least a little bit of an interest in the game of golf, and I believe that this game is perfect for the people looking to get into the actual game. As a simulator, The Golf Club is about as good as it gets with the technology and resources that the devs have. All I'm saying by this is that this game is obviously still in Early Access, so you cannot expect it to be a GOTY golf game right out of nowhere. If you do have a friend who is interested in the game of golf, introduce them to this game and see how they like the concept of the game first. Of course, this is still a video game, so it does not quite present the greatest representation of golf in reality. It does, however, have some of the qualities though. You have to judge your shots carefully and watch out for hazards. You have to read the break on the greens and also the speed of them. This game will definitely show some of the qualities of how a bad golf round can all of a sudden turn good and more often than not, a good golf round going bad. I usually spend hours on the course everyday trying to practice and get better and when I leave the course, I just want more and more. So when it's late at night and all you can think of is playing golf, launch this game and play the hell out of it. The course editor will allow you to have hours of fun creating the course of your dreams or even a silly, fun course that isn't fair at all. The online game modes are incredibly fun and will keep competitive golfers competitive at home. Just buy this game if you love or have an interest in golf. You will certainly put a few hours into the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After a drought of golf on PC, The Golf Club brings back this casual sport and it really has done PC proud, even int he current ALPHA state it's better than any of the Tiger Woods games, and has a strong feel of the old Links series I loved back in the 486 era of PC, having a course editor is a massive bonus too.

Tried the multiplayer mode and it's simply fantastic, you can play a full course at you own pace, none of the waiting for other to complete a hole before moving on to the next, you see realtime shot telemetry of other players and ghost players of your previous attempts at the courses to play along with you and friends too... awesome idea!

Highly recommended

reviewText:
Let me start by listing pros and cons to this game.

Pros:
-Game looks very well, even on the lowest settings.
-Once everything is figured out, can be fun for someone looking to play golf.
-Course Editors are always a plus, and not a bad one if you take the time to see where everything is.
-Tutorials for almost everything in this game.

Cons:
-Unable to fully tell how hard you hit the ball, or putt
-Grid on putting is to big.
-Graphic optination needs to be worked on a little better.

As a player and have made games in the past and hopefully sell some on Steam in the future, the fixes for two of the cons is quite simple to me.  For hitting the ball, a precent gage someplace would be nice.  I have brought my stick back on my game pad to roughly the same area and have hit the ball from 100% to 80%. This is not very good in my opinion.
The putting grid, well, just needs to have more grid lines to it, the system, once you figure it out or watch the tutorial, is very good otherwise.

If these two where fixed, i think this would be a very good game.

8/10

I am recommending this game for those who like or love golf.  The game has it's issues, and may take from the game from time to time, but sometimes it feels a little real without going out to a course with clubs yourself.

reviewText: Very well done Golf sim, about the best you will get on PC for a very long time. The course editor is very easy and since can easily play anyone elses, you can never run out of new holes to play. And with the multiplayer style they do, you never really feel as is you are playing alone even when you of course are. The graphics are quite nice and the commentary that goes along with your game is a very nice touch.

reviewText: Having played the game in early access and full release it's quite impressive although to play on full resolution you need a super powerful graphics card. I am currently playing the game windowed and on 1024 x 768 to acheive a decent frame rate with my measly geforce GT610 card. The course creator works really well and puts me in mind of the great Jack Nicklaus course designer of yesteryear. You can build a super detailed masterpiece or a quick knockaround course with relative ease and play at anytime to make sure it's what you want. The golf mechanics of the game itself are quite realistic but would still like to see some kind of gauge for the swing if only one that could be turned on and off at any time. Also many people still favour the old tri click method so if that was implemented it would give the game true flexibility. One annoying bug i have noticed is that when you start a game with either ghost balls or more added golfers if you then exit the round after a couple of holes it saves your progress automatically but when you return your single golfer self is now the only one playing. Anyway theres no other golf game that can really come close to this one at the moment it has flexibilty, great multiplayer features and a jaw dropping course creator. Keep up the good work guys and keep on updating the game regulary.

reviewText: I bought this game when it first came out and it has quickly gone downhill since that time.  Every patch makes it worse.  Now I cannot even complete a swing.  The club goes back about 20% then resets.  I have browsed their forums and many people have complained about this issue along with other graphical issues introduced in the latest patches.  They all agree that the game has gone to crap and no-one from the dev team has bothered to even respond to them.  This was a great golf game with a great course designer but now I cannot recommend it to anyone.
voteText: 11 of 21 people (52%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I was looking forward to this game very much. It has been on my wishlist for quite a while so I was very excited to finally buy it today. After 5 holes I gave up and am asking for a refund after only 30 minutes of gameplay. I can't say it's a bad game but I think it would probably be better with a controller (which I don't use). I'm used to the Tiger Woods PGA Tour series of golf games and when I got to the buggy mess that was TWPGAT 08 I had had enough. I bought this thinking it would be a great replacement but was sorely dissapointed. Everything seems to move really slow, the swing, the ball and the cameras. It was like trying to play in molasses in winter. As well the courses were not as realistically made either. The fairways were too skinny and the texture for them was not that realistic. TWPGAT 08 looked more realistic to me than this. I would have to say my biggest gripe is the swing mechanism. It just doesn't feel right. There was no backward and forward swing, just backward. It didn't feel natural not following your swing through to the ball, but I think that is the console port mechanics again. Like I said this is probably a different game if you are used to a controller, but I'm not so it was a real missed hit with me.
voteText: 13 of 25 people (52%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: The Golf Club is an exceptionally good golfing simulation marred with a few frustrations. Aside from an abundance of overly difficult courses to play and the blatant cheating by other online players, the game offers a very realistic playing experience where often times you'll hear yourself saying, thats exactly how this would play if I was out there myself." The devolopers have promised throughout beta that they would continue to improve upon the game and actively work with players to create the best golf simulation they can. I know for myself
date: I keep being drawn back from other games to play this one day after day."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TLDR: If you enjoy all of golfs challenging aspects, this game will totally be worth it to you.

As it says in the big blue box below, the game is an Early Access Game.  However, if you have a half decent computer, I highly recommend getting this game while it is still discounted for Early Access.

There are a few things to consider:

The Negatives
Graphics settings are limited to your resolution and three quality settings: high, medium, and low.
With graphics on low or medium, you only get a 5 yd x 5 yd putting grid when you get a 15 yd x 15 yd putting grid on high quality settings.
The game is extremely GPU dependent.  My AMD FX-6350 is around 35% to 60% in the six cores while my GPU is almost always pinned on 99% or 100% at high graphics settings.
UI feels clunky with mouse and keyboard but it is fine with a controller.
The user created courses tend to get polluted with courses that really aren't that well made or aren't anywhere close to realistic.  However, if you look in the right places (the forums or other player created sites), you can find some very extraordinary courses.

The Positives
Overall, the game is very realistic.  Of course there are a few bugs here and there due to the early access that cause some pretty strange physics
date:
but that rarely ever happens.  Some examples:
Ball below your feet = push right; vice versa for ball above your feet.
The wind speeds seem very realistic when pushing the ball around along with the elevation changes.    Putting takes some getting used to but it is solely based on the player controller marker" that you move around to adjust your line and power.  Putting is basically the most polished aspect of the game IMO.
The more difficult a shot is
recommended: the skinnier the "perfect swing" area will get.  Playing a draw
voteText: high
helpfulPercent:
or low shot all affect the margin of error when the player is swinging.
The lie you have for your shot is a range of percentages.  Plugging into a bunker gives you ~40% to 60% of that clubs power for the shot out of the bunker and that percentage changes for each club.  Obviously a fairway wood is difficult to hit out of a fairway bunker.
The course creator is very easy to use with a controller and has improved significantly since it first came out.
Any specific questions
votesHelpful: you are more than welcome to PM me or add me as a friend for some competition. :D"
votesFunny: true

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A definite thumbs up from me. My first early access game and I am duly impressed. Reminds me of Links 2003 for some reason only much better. After not being able to get Links running anymore I started playing the EA TW PGA Tour games until they came to a halt. I'm still ♥♥♥♥♥♥ at EA for dropping golf and hockey from the PC. I have been looking for a great PC golf game for quite a while now and I think I've found it.

Having read a lot of the reviews, I see that a few people want the old 3 click swing and the developers have said that they conciously decided not to put power bars, etc in the game, and I think that was an excellent decision. Must admit that I was a tad skeptical about using a gamepad. My performance on my first few holes was laughable at best, but I quickly improved as I got used to using my Xbox for Windows gamepad. I soon realized that this swing method is about as close as you can get to the complexity of a real golf swing, and it adds a bit of realism to the game for me. I have found driving to be the easiest, and although my short game and putting are improving, they still need some practise. So, I haven't even tried the KB/mouse method and I don't care about the 3 click swing - I'm good with the gamepad.

Graphics are very good indeed, especially for an early build, as it currently is. The game runs smoothly on my system with nary an issue, although, I have recently upgraded my system substantially, so that could have something to do with it, from what I have read in the reviews.

I have been recommending the game to friends and I most certainly recommend the game to those reading this. If you are into computer golf at all,  I can almost guarantee that you will enjoy this game, and this is still an early build. So, a sincere thanks to the developers for delivering a 'top of the line' body of work, which has been a long time coming to the PC, and to Steam for making it available to us. And whilst I'm farting flowers over here, hats off to Steam - I have become a fan - it's a great way to game!
voteText: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Although it's still being developed, I had to say: A Great Golf Game, definitely worthy to pay for it.

I think some common problem for golf game is that by selecting the shooting target directly on the map, you would get too percise shot easily. And, that is not the true golf always be. By selecting the direct, simulating swing by controller or mouse, I just feel I am playing golf. The controller will give you percise shot easily, and you will find mouse is closer to your swing in life. That struggle makes me feel great.

It is still developing, I want to see more game modes and customing clubs in future. Don't know if it could be true.

Oh, different types of players also desired. E.g. Strong swinger / Percise shoter, etc.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Even in early access, this is (or at least shaping up to be) the best golf game I've ever played.

About the controls: for those who played and enjoyed GTA 5 and its golf game, you'll probably enjoy this too.
No crappy time based swinging which has been done WAY too many times, instead you actually use precision, not reflex.

I never really recommend any game in alpha, beta, early access or whatever.
But this I will. I hope that's saying something.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAfter seeing a lot of people having performance issues I was hesitant to buy this but I am glad I did. reviewText: I've been looking for a game to fill the void in my heart left by one of my favorite console series games, Tiger Woods. This game actually does that pretty well. However this game is slightly more challenging than TW series. I would consider this more sim" type and TW more of an arcade simulator. The part that stands out to be the most difficult is the putting. Which I haven't quiet nailed down yet and sometimes can be a little frustrating. That said I've played a few rounds on this game and have really enjoyed it. The graphics aren't bad but in this day in age could be a little better. It definitely has that Unity engine look/feel. reviewText:
Update 10/5/14:  Verdict - I'm putting up the clubs until things are fixed.

I've put a ton of hours into this game (170+ hours), only because the developer (who is active on the forums), promised to improve the game in a number of areas since the games release.  Unfortunately, they haven't.

GOOD:

Course developer - It's awesome.  The addition of Greg Norman's team made a world of difference.  Cheers to the developer for putting out such a great tool kit.  The possibilities are literally endless, as are the number of courses.  I do wish the developers would allow us to insert interactive spectators/crowds to add to the realism of tournament golf.  If you're interstested in course design, this is as good as it gets at the moment.

Graphics - When it's not having framerate issues (again, on the latest and greatest GPU/CPU on the market), it's a treat to look at.  Some of the greens appear to be jagged around the edges on high spots, but overall, they look good.

BAD:

Framerate - Nothing has been done to address the glitchiness/bugs in this game.  For instance, on many of the games courses (predominantly on Links or Desert courses), the screen simply stutters upon any movement.  On some courses, the ball or hole on the greens just disappear.  Try attempting to make a putt with no ball or hole.  The developer stated they were working on fixing these bugs over a month ago, however, it is quite evident they've done nothing to solve these issues.  That is extremely frustrating when some courses do not have this issue, are beautiful to look at, and run smoothly

Stats - This is supposed to be a simulation game, but the stats keeper makes ZERO sense.  Hey developer, golfers are stat freaks and are always looking to improve.  There's no way to compare yourself to anyone else playing the game when the stats/rating system are completely screwed up.  FYI - The developer stated they would address this in Aug too.  They haven't.  That's telling.....

Modes of play - A lot left to be desired.  I'm hoping in the next game (if there is one), will be interesting and keep the gamer engaged.  Maybe try getting the PGA Tour to sponsor a future game.  More game/match modes will people interested in playing your game.

Game physics;
Putting - It is what it is.  At best, it's inconsistent (at all distances) and there is a huge learning curve.  New players will either tolerate or hate it.  It will frustrate you, there's no getting around that.  It still needs work and fine tuning.

Distance control - The best way to gauge distance is to adjust the percentance of the shot and swing 100% (not realistic).  Around the greens, it's terrible.  There's also no skill involved in hitting everything 100%.  From the get go of the game, everyone hits the ball exactly the same distance and your distance never improves with your player's career progress.

Glitches - I've already mentioned the framerate problems, but there's other things that need to be addressed.  For instance, let's say you hit your driver or a low punch shot into the sand.  Congrats, your ball will be plugged everytime.....not kidding.  If it rolls in, you've got half a chance.  If your pitch/chip hits the pin (even softly), enjoy watching it rocket across the green behind you.  Great way to ruin a good round.  Lastly, if you hit your ball into the water, 99% of the time, the game makes you rehit for your previous location and does not allow you to drop on the line of the ball into the water.  The player should at least have the option.  When the games does drop for you, sometimes it puts you into the ruff.....

Controls - It's much easier to play on a keyboard then controller.

Player model/swing - There's only one.  Why?!

Final verdict:  I love golf, whether in real life or on the computer.  However, this game leaves me with the feeling of untapped potential.  I hope, going forward, the developer gets it right and listens to its user base who want it to succeed (I do).  Unfortunately, at this point, the negatives out weigh the positives.  Yes, the game can be beautiful to look at, but the frustrations of the a faulty swing system and complete lack modes can not be overcome by a fantastic course creator.  With that, I'm putting my sticks away until EA Sports releases the next iteration of PGA Tour golf or The Golf Club 2 is released and it's a complete game.

reviewText:
I love the game of golf and I find my self experiencing the same raw emotions playing this game as I do on the real golf course.  For example when I sink a long put I'm up out of my chair fist pumping just like I would on the golf course after a same type of shot.  Then on the flip side I'm cussing up a storm when I miss hit or mess up a put.  It's why I keep coming back for more.

I can pick up a quick game and stop in the middle of a round if need be and the game saves where I'm on the course automatically.  The graphics are great and works well on my laptop for easy portability for golf on the go.  I have played the game since early access and the dev team continues to listen to the players and continue to update the game.

I cant say enough about the replay ability of this game due to the Course Designer and the multiple courses out there already.

Huge thumbs up!

reviewText: the game is primarily designed to be played with a controller. Unless you own or plan to buy one, don't bother with it. It's unplayable with the mouse. I have seen golf sims on games 20 years older with more control over te shot. In this one you have to click drag the mouse back then drag it forward. There is no feeling of control for the shot or ability to hit consistently. Even then nothing in the game tells you how to take a shot, you have to go to the community discussions and check the keyboard mouse faq, and there is no built-in option to change the controls. The game designers should rethink their design and learn from tiger woods golf games or even the classical Links series. Avoid buying this at all costs.

reviewText:
I like the social and course building aspects of this game... but the controls, whether using a gamepad and especially when using a mouse and keyboard (I've tried both), are incredibly difficult and need a lot of work before this game will be playable.

It is fairly easy to make the perfectly straight 100% power shots every time, so the driving game is almost too easy, but when you need a little finesse, like hitting the ball at 60-90% power, forget it.

The distance estimates applied to the clubs can't be trusted, especially on shorter shots like lobs and chips, the distances are frequently off by a few dozen yards.

Putting is especially broken, because there is only one power spectrum, 0-105 feet, so if you want to make an 5-10 foot putt, in other words apply 5-10% power, getting anywhere close to correct is virtually impossible, you're just as likely to putt it 30 feet or 2 feet.

reviewText: This is perhaps the most infuriatingly poorly-controlling golf game I think I've ever played. Control over your swing varies massively from one stroke to the next and there's absolutely zero sense of the power you're putting behind any given shot. Putting is obnoxiously difficult for both of those reasons.\n\nAlthough one can certainly (probably) get used to playing it, getting to that point is not at all an enjoyable road. Some would say that this just means it's a more serious golf simulation and perhaps that's true for some people, but this isn't at all accessible for people looking for a less excrutiating experience.

reviewText: Really enjoying The Golf Club, especially taking on new courses every round. The physics and swing mechanics are strong (I'm a big fan of Links 2004 and am playing with an Xbox controller) and while it will take a while to feel comfortable (there are no swing meters) once you can use the advanced ball control to fine tune your distances the game becomes a lot more fun.\n\nIt can look beautiful, though there are a couple of shadowing glitches I've seen, but the core golf game here I really like. Some user created courses are devilish, some creators are truly evil with the slope they put on greens, but for the most part courses are made with love and some of the official courses are very good (but I do find some are too simple). I've been playing since early access and the game has made dramatic improvements, something I hope continues post release but The Golf Club is a fantastic game for those who won't miss character progression or career modes.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Golf Club
Real life placement of where you hit the ball! So, if you hit it in the tress or shallow water, you will then be behind them trees or in that water but still able to hit it out! I had on shank drive go on another holes fairway and got to play back towards my green from there!

The game feels like real putting and real GOLF during shot previews and when you hit the ball! Nothing like tiger woods game where the game would basically show you everything, putt previews, before shot line of where it will go and much more non realistic ♥♥♥♥! The Golf Club will kind of show you where the ball will land (in a given area) but that can be toggled off.

Easy to use controls and gorgeous courses! And the best part is people and even you can make your own course, which is not impossible! Then share the course with the world! Then people can rate it and favorite it. Plus the way multi player is handle no is with ghost of other players round, which you can pick who you want to show, best part is this can be done all on the fly as you play your round!

I'm addicted and this is so bare bones of what it will be! I can't wait for different clubs and skills points to make golfers more uniquely skilled. I could care less about making my golfer look different or changing his outfit. The career and tour modes will add more of that because I see where they have spots in the UI to show and have you accumulate points.

There is probably a few other details I'm missing but I will update this as I remember more reasons why I love this game so much!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very solid game thus far. A few qualms. Not being able to skip through the entire shot animation is fairly annoying. After a while, you just get bored with seeing the post-shot animation or waiting for a ball to stop rolling. Also, the putting never feels quite right. It might be that it simply takes some getting used to, but there's not really much of a guide to it. I don't know what generates speed, pulling the putter back a certain distance or how quickly I shift to the forward position on the analog stick...or both. Just really confusing. Not a lot of clarification, making putting one of the single most frustrating things about the game...much like actual golf, I suppose.

Overall, though...amazing game. For an early access build, the game reeks of polish. I would like some more options with shot setup, such as foot placement, pinpointing feel (pulling the shot back to the target and utilizing the percentage listed there to make the adjustment), and slope degredation from golfer to target would allow shot setup to be more user-friendly. Hopefully, some of these options will be available at retail, but if they aren't, it's still a great golf game...and it's on PC. And that's a rare thing.

reviewText:
What an utter disappointment.

I bought this game after seeing the recent positive reviews thinking that It would be as good as some of the old Tiger Woods games but in fact this game just annoys the hell out of me.

First of all, when I had installed this game and attempted to start it, it kept on crashing continuously. I couldn't start the game at all. After lots of searching and experimentation, I eventually discovered that the reason the game wouldn't start is because I had SLI enabled on my graphics card. It turns out that this game hates SLI cards so much that it won't even launch when it is enabled. If I wanted to play the game, I had to play it with SLI disabled (this is a big issue for me as I have a GTX 690 which is a dual GPU card meaning that I would take a massive performance hit).

The game seems unoptimised too. Using one GPU of my card (essentially a GTX 680 performance wise), the game, on its lowest settings with AA off, would rarely rise above 40FPS.

The gameplay itself is fairly fun but feels a little clunkier than the old Tiger Woods games especially when it comes to the short game around the greens. Without a doubt, the best thing about the game in my opinion is the course designer. It is just so fun to create your own custom courses and the sheer number of user created courses is staggering.

Probably the biggest beef with this game however, is the putting! It just infuriates me.

You just don't feel that you are in control of the ball. And the worst part is that there is just no indication of how hard you are hitting the ball. You are just expected to judge power, but the putting feels very clunky so it is almost impossible to do. You always either hit the ball way too far or way too short. I just don't see why there isn't any sort of power meter.

In summary:

+ Great course designer
+ In most cases, fun and interesting gameplay
+ Tons of user created courses to play on

- Clunky feel when taking shots
- Putting is pretty annoying

Overall, 5/10

reviewText:
Well I originally gave this title a lot of credit, 10 months ago.  It was playable, had potential and seemed like it was going somewhere good.  However, having just picked up the game again after a long hiatus **ahem Perfect Golf** I have not seen the improvements and FEATURES that are essential to a great golf game.

-Optimization has been improved but the issues linger.  That's a problem!

-Most importantly LOBBY.  Why in the world has this not been added?  Golf is a competitive game, and yet the ways for players to connect and compete are just not there.  That's a problem!

-The swing mechanics and ball-turf interaction are still as poor as I remember, back when it was in EA.


I'm sure you all have heard of Perfect Golf.  It's not the prettiest golf sim but it is far more authentic, if that is indeed what you are looking for in a golf game.


Also, it's had a functioning lobby since day one EA.

reviewText:
You would have more fun teeing up a turd, hitting it at full force with a driver and watching it explode. I know you want a golf game, but trust me this isn't it.

This game runs embarrasingly inefficient. System specs:

i7-4770K, OC'd 4.1 ghz
Geforce GTX 770 (MSI TF n770)
16 GB DDR3 ram
3TB HDD
Z87-g45 mobo

I can't get better than 31fps. When the game was in beta, I could get 60 in windowed mode, and 30 fullscreen. I don't know what the ♥♥♥♥ is going on, but it sure as hell isn't optimized. And even if it were, the graphics look kinda clunky, second-rate. The reflections off the water are at times glaringly terrible. These were issues that were easy to overlook during Early Access. You know, things you expect to be fixed before launch. Oh how wrong we all were.

This will be the last title I support in Early Access.

The controls are really bad. You have no way to judge exactly how much swing you're applying, other than 100%. The power applied during the swing IS NOT PROPROTIONATE TO THE BACKSWING. Meaning, if you take a full backswing, and apply slow pressure upward, you could swing 10%, 45%, or hell maybe 88%. It's all a crapshoot. Instead of using a visual meter, you're supposed to learn to Feel" the swing and the club.

Sorry HB
date: that's not the way that games work. I'm not actually holding a club. I don't have Chubbs to show me the hip technique.\n\nThe controls are especially terrible in your approach game. Need 60 yards with your Pitching wedge? Sorry
recommended: the closest we can do is full blast at 120 yards
hoursPlayed: good luck estimating your power for a half swing because your backswing has nothing to do with the result. Again
voteText: no visual standard. Oh
helpfulPercent: you didn't want to hit it 85 yards over the green and into the water? Better luck next time
votesHelpful: because that's all it is
votesTotal:
luck.

Here's some other thoughts:
-Announcer is painfully annoying. You'll want to kill him.
-All the players look like they could have had the same parents.
-Course creator is okay
votesFunny: but the finished product always looks rough.\n-Cheaters are using "edging" techniques to never hit anything but a straight shot. Have fun with that.\n-You can count the number of songs featured in the game on one hand. In fact
commentsCount:
roughly half of your hand.
-No crowd. No atmosphere.
-No player progression. You'll always drive 100% max at 265 yards with no wind.
-No live multiplayer.

-No reason you should consider buying this game.

Give me Tiger Woods 2004 on the Xbox over this any day of the week. I wish I could get my money back for this. Don't buy it.

I know

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I just finished my first 9 holes and i have to say the game is GREAT so far.

I golf for real once a week or so and I have to say this game is the closest to real golf I have seen. There are no gimmicks here. I didn't even bother with mouse/keyboard. By this point every PC gamer should own a good controller (I have a flight stick too), invest in a XBox, PS3/4 or PC gamepad controller.

The way you set up is like in real life, you can choose draw or fade, high or low shots using the joystick. The putting seems really good so far too.

I have not had any crashes or bugs. Yes it runs a little slow but my rig is modest and it is extremely playable. As for the lack of content reviews, there is a course creator in here. I have not tried it yet but that should be amazing.

+ You can create your own course. I am actually making the one I work at in real life.
+ Many, many different courses to try out
+ Swing is just awesome! Unlike other games, what is unique with this one is: No power-meter! And no 3-click swing. Which gives great challenge! Exactly what I was looking for. It does not take many hours to get used to it and get your own feel about it.
+ Good graphics, cannot really complain about this one.
+ Ball physics is good
+ Good community and good staff. Lets hope they keep updating the game with new stuff!
+ Etc..etc..a lot more positive stuff.

- Only negative part about this game is that I cannot find anything negative about it!

Buy, play and enjoy! See you out there, golfers!

reviewText: I waited for a long time for something to play as a golf simulation and not like the Tiger Woods series of games. Something with purpose and enjoyment. So I was excited to buy this as early access amd see a golf game done right. I waited a solid 2 months to see if the improvements would come in for the game splitting and graphics disappearing after one round of golf. Instead I just got more broken gamemodes that would only work for about 1 hour of game play. There are splitting screenshots on my profile showing I'm not making it up.\n\nWith more and more companies releasing games for a higher price it surprises me that they are releasing these broken games to customers without any updates or acknowledgement that the product is broken. A little consideration to fans that supported the company before release would help a lot more. I would recommend this game had it been fixed by now with small graphics errors but I cannot. Wait for something better or for another update that would fix anything.

reviewText:
I bought this game on sale, after reading many reviews, both positive and negative. I am a golfer, and the simple presentation and great graphics of this game were enticing. However, I quickly found that my $25 were wasted.

The game's performance makes it virtually unplayable. My computer can run most modern games on decent settings and get a good framerate, however, on the lowest settings (graphics options are extremely uncustomizable), I could hardly pull 5-10 FPS in a lightly-wooded area. The game's sluggishness also caused a lot of glitches with sound. Furthermore, my PS3 controller was unable to be used properly despite proper set-up of drivers (I use it for emulators), this might just be a personal problem though.

Overall, unless you have an extremely powerful rig, this game is not a good choice.

reviewText:
I got this on steam sale, and still feel ripped off.
It truly feels like a beta release in look and feel.

I can see that this will receive very little in the way of updates, as i feel a complete re-write would be required to make it playable.

Pros:

Cons:

- Player details is poor and looks like a 2005 spec

- Unable to change from Imperial to Metric !!! (WTF in 2014? seriously).
- Please show me the help option
- Please show me the tutorial
- Does not naturally flow or make sense
- Inability to seriously gauge the power of any shot (inc putting)
- Incredibly annoying commentary (can turn down the volume, but can't reduce the amount of speech)
- Very difficult to play with keyboard/mouse
- Partial controller support" should be re-worded to "Almost impossible to use without"
- Where is the tutorial ? Seriously start pressing buttons and clicking around in a game to find this stuff ?
- "outstanding gameplay are to be expected" ... still expecting ..... still not seeing it
- No help.  Go to the forums to view help ? WHAT ?
- I have played golf for 30 years

reviewText:
Pros: No loading screens between each hole. Graphics are okay but not nearly as good as Tiger Woods. Create a course is a very good idea but is not very easy to use and many of the courses I've seen created are very horsey in terms of their design and make it difficult to progress.

Cons: Nearly impossible to hit 100% shot without using your mouse. Many holes you get in a situation where you need to be able to hit 100% shot and if you do not, you end up in the drink. The game is lacking content in terms of campaign modes. There is no golf shop to get better gear. The create a golfer is not robust, leaving you with a very lackluster golfer that looks very bland with no characteristics.

Advice To The Developers: Please take a minute to realize that there are many holes in the games that require you to be able to hit 100% shots. I do not mind that I'm not able to hit 100% shot as I feel that adds a realesitic touch to the game but at the same time, it's very frustrating to reach a hole where you cannot progress due to the design of the course. Also consider adding more unique content such as a true campaign mode for us player who do not care to play tournaments 24/7. Perhaps even add in challenge style mini games to enhance replayability.

Rating: 2.5 stars out of 5

reviewText:
Thought this was going to be good. However after a few goes playing it I can't stand much more of it. The roll of the ball is so unrealistic. The ball manages to only bounce once and then a small roll from the Tea using a driver. Yet on the greens you will often find the slopes will carry the ball on for ever and without even using much power you end up further away than you started.

Was non of this even pointed out during testing.
Totally awful.

Oh and the much hyped course designer doesn't really let you design much. You just select a few features. You don't have control over actually designing holes etc.

Save ya money folks and just stick to last years Tiger Woods

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I recommend this game with a few caveats. Make sure to get a controller. You can get a 360 controller for $30 and had best buy price match it. Plugs right into the PC, no setup required. Graphics are fairly nice, frame rate is pretty bad, course editor is great, and it's much more of a sim than a casual golf game. And for now you can only play a single round.

Does anyone know how to get in touch with the developers? The putting system needs help badly. You can't look at the contour of your whole putt and you pretty much have to guess how hard to hit it. All you know is your putter hits it 105 feet at full swing. The rest is a guessing game. Same with iron and wedge shots. There is no marker/meter/percentage...anything to indicate where your swing should stop/how far to hit it. So you basically have to hit it 100% or risk hitting it 40%. This part REALLY needs work and I hope they fix it because if not, the final product will be an unenjoyable expereience. Also, when you preview your shot there is no reticle whatsoever, so you have no idea if you're going to hit it into or over a fairway bunker, water, etc. It's pretty bad.

I'm recommending it because of the core game that is in place. But if the developers don't make serious gameplay improvements, it could ultimately end up being a pretty bad game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When I saw the trailer of this game, I figured I just had to have it, I went to GameStop to purchase another Steam card to buy it. The trailer is very deceptive/alluring, too bad the gameplay looks/feels nothing like it does in the trailer.

I knew there'd be problems as soon as the menu took forever just to scroll through. I know it's in its beta stage, but this is inexcusable. Tiger Woods PGA 2001 ran much smoother than this does...

My graphics card is able to support games like Skyrim, the Elder Scrolls Online, GTA 4, and Flight Simulator X on MAX settings with absolutely NO lag/frame rate issues. NONE. When I played this, I had to set the graphics quality to LOW and it was STILL laggy, so if its lagging on your end, trust me, it isn't YOUR card's fault.

This has a lot of potential, and I hope they fix it up a LOT more before the launch date.

reviewText:
So i wrote an early access review for this game before it was finished, in favor of the Golf Club.  But my review has changed, and here is why.

-Nothing has changed gameplay wise since EA
-Runs like crap on top end systems
-No Multiplayer support (BIG HIT FOR ME)
-Mouse and keyboard users dominate Controlers
-Expensive for a game

They claim the swing mechanics are exclusive and special?  There is nothing special about this game.  Nothing.  Its a golf game.  They asked the community what they would like to see in game.  We responded.  They added nothing we suggested, or changed anything we didn't like about the game.

I can't play cross platform either.  Its 2014, xbox one got this indie title and there is no way to see your friends on xbox.  Lame.  Not that you can really play against anyone, as its more of a rival/see their shot on the hole type mode.

Course designer is nice.  I have actually been using this since they first implemented it in the EA way back 2-3 months ago.
Ive had this game since its launch, and will most likely be avoiding playing this title any further.  I will wait for something else, as this game is nothing special.

6.5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game definitely has its perks, but I cannot honestly recommend to the average golf gamer. Being a PC gamer, I hadn't played a golf game since TW08 so I was excited for this game coming out on PC. I played it quite a bit at first, but have ultimately become bored with it and can't see myself playing much more (FWIW my actual time spent on this game is probably closer to ~40 hours than what is displayed on my profile). I'll start off with the good:

1. The course creator. The course creator is loads of fun, relatively easy to jump into, and is capable of creating many different layouts. Camera controls, and the terrain tools (mostly the hill brushes) I found annoying at times, but nothing game breaking.

2. The game looks extremely good visually. Furthermore, using the lighting options in the course creator, you can create some absolutely spectacular views on your course.

3. Putting. Putting is very rewardable in this game making you actually work for many short putts, and making distance control a challenge for long range putts.

As for the bad:

1. While the game looks good visually with high end settings, don't expect to actually be able to play with good graphics unless you have a good gaming computer. My high end non-gaming laptop, which does meet the system requirements, can only run the game smoothly on a 800x600 resolution with low graphical detail. Quite frankly, the game looks ten years old with these settings. From discussions on here and the HB website, the graphics card seems to be the problem. I have a GeForce 630M, so if your graphics card is comparable to that don't expect to be able to play with reasonable looking graphics.

2. Single player lacks any sort of depth. Given that all you can do is play a round of golf, unless creating courses is your thing, don't expect much replayability. Don't know about multiplayer because I don't care about it.

3. My biggest problem with this game is simply that it isn't close to a realistic golf sim. I easily hit over 90% of fairways, never unintentionally hook or slice the ball, hit probably around 80% of greens in regulation, hit clear over the green from the green side bunker half the time, hit a 75% shot anywhere from 30-100%, and despite putting being pretty good, I still hit a 5ft putt 20ft past the hole on occasion. This kills the game for me. I think a lot these problems come from lacking difficulty sliders, which in my view are essential for any good sports sim game. If you're expecting realistic results from this game, there is a good chance you will be severely disappointed.

4. Mouse/keyboard controls are a nightmare. I gave up with the mouse/keyboard after a couple of hours, and borrowed my friends xbox360 controller instead. Would strongly recommend using an analog controller.

I would recommend purchasing this game if course creation is really your thing, but if you are looking for an in depth realistic golf sim, I can't recommend The Golf Club.

reviewText:
I hadn't played a golf game in a while, and once you've played one tiger woods you've played them all, so I thought I'd give this a go.

The reviews were solid, but this game is dreadful. The graphics are like something from 10 years ago, controlling the swing  is a joke, and putting is complete blind luck.

It's quite a nice idea - build a huge amount of courses and allow people to play online - but the reality is a bunch of samey, characterless courses which feel nothing like the real thing.

And you have to use a controller. You can use the mouse, but it's the worst control I've ever experienced ever in a computer game.

3/10

reviewText: A one word description for this game is CLUNKY."  The game physics are really REALLY BAD.  Without a special type controller (like a Wii controller) the swing meter is very hard to use especially with a mouse.  The ball physics aren't true and a single tee box system for all skill levels is very poor in design.  In real golf one doesn't expect a high handicapper or some who can't hit for distance to play from the Championship Tees but the way this game is setup all the holes designed for the stock courses are like playing from these tees.  A four tee system would be an improvement.  Trying to use the system settings box at the start of the game requires a degree in computer science to figure out and even then when do try to adjust a setting the game engine gets worse.  This game still has a LONG LONG WAY to go before its ready for prime time especioally for DX11.  This games competitor is further along than this and is still "early development."\n\nThis game grades at: F"

reviewText:
Less than 40 rounds played and I already have an ace from over 200 yards out, eagles from 100yds out, and atleast a dozen other shots into the cup from off the green from various distances.

This game is clearly tailored to shooting unrealistically low scores. The swings are dumbed down enough to teach a 3yr old to hit straight, and all the information you need, and precise loft control with grids and percentages is given to make a shot of any distance nearly effortless. This is dial-a-shot-golf, void of any risk/reward you may be looking for in a golf game. Putting, however, does require a special touch, but on an average course you have to mess up pretty bad or not be paying attention to be left with putts of any significant distance. It is not a stretch by any means to say this game would have been dead in the water if it weren't for countless community made courses because the gameplay is dull and unrewarding.

Simply put, if you are here because you love golf and are looking for an authentic experience, I would turn away and look elsewhere.

reviewText:
BOO to hotbox and the people who made this game.  Promises were broken, tears were shed and what was left for us was a half-broken dream that never was.  BOO.

Stuttering framerate, zero PC optimization after a 4month Early Access period.  This game should run like clockwork.  Stop making excuses for blatant ♥♥♥♥ poor development and for releasing a game that simply does not work.

The physics of the game are a joke, the wind plays zero part in the ball physics, it's impossible to accurately chip, the putting mechanic is broken and mostly unusable with a mouse and keyboard.

The Early Access period on steam was used to garner revenuse and fine tune the Console version of the game.  I am well aware of the development process and the joke it has become.  Patching has essentially hobbled motivation to produce a decent game.  Apologists would have you believe this is a day one release and that these problems simply appeared out of thin air.

The fact of the matter is that this game was released on steam during an Early Access period in which ALL THE ISSUES in this game were brought to developments attention.  These are not Day 0" issues."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Preliminary feelings as of June 2014:

This game seems to try very hard to overheat my video card.  I've run Titanfall, Arkham Origins, and Battlefield on very high settings without any issue, but this game slowly degrades and starts glitching out and artifacting all over the place.  The temps are higher than those other games.  I'm running a Radeon r9 270.

The swing/put mechanism is nice I guess, but it is certainly not inherently better than the more classic interfaces from older games.  One could argue that this introduces a realistic element of skill" and "practice" but that would be neglecting to mention that not everyone has the same controller setup
date: nor do people have the same hands
recommended: nor do people have the same amount of time to practice.  This is a video game that people paid for so there really isn't a need to create a gap to simulate the fact that some people are just going to be bad at golf without massive amounts of practice.  At the very least
hoursPlayed: add in a more classical control scheme option for more casual players so that people who want a fun PC golf game can have it while the more hardcore golf fans can have their some what more sim styled game at the same time.\n\nThe courses are plentiful and you can edit and create new ones so there really is no point in rating those.  The course system they have is excellent
voteText:
however and exactly what a golf game needs.  Kudos to that.  Another kudos is the way you play against ghost rivals.

Minor annoyance:  Cannot name guest players in hot seat multiplayer.  Jeopardy on the NES lets me name each player.  No excuses.

Unfortunately I cannot recommend the game for the current price at this moment.  I'll fiddle with the game a bit more to see if I can improve the performance
helpfulPercent: and hopefully future patches improve everything in general.  This has the makings of the best golf game on for PCs
votesHelpful: and one of the best ever
votesTotal: but it definitely has a ways to go."

reviewText:
1) The swing motion is exponential realtive to your mouse instead of 1:1 (meaning your in game swing starts much slower and weaker than the mouse movement would imply but eventually gets up to speed. I believe this is what forum people call rubber banding.) causing chipping and putting to be extremely difficult. (long delays in motions that are supposed to be ~1-2 seconds)

2) The character is still doing pre-swing motions after I click and drag back to start my swing, meaning the mouse and swing have completely disconnected from each other.

3) I played 36 holes before uninstalling, I turned the commentary off after 2.

After reading thru a lot of forum posts to see if the complete lack of feel during the short game is just me or not, it seems to be affecting a lot of people using a mouse instead of a console controller. Sounds like a good game if you plug in a controller, I strongly recommend staying away from this game if you plan on using a mouse.

reviewText: I love golf games, and I will probably continue to play this one from time to time, but I don't recommend it, and I wouldn't buy it again. The pros are that the game runs super smoothly, the courses are beautiful and the ability to easily create your own courses (although I've never made one myself - I have played a few created ones, and they were well done). However, the game is extremely inconsistent when it comes to gameplay. Most of the time, you need a club or less than the recommended club for a particular length. 170 yards on flat ground, no elevation change and no wind? Choose a club that hits 158 yards, or even a club lower. Use the club that's supposed to hit 170, and you'll be lucky if the ball doesn't go 190 yards.  Putting is also very inconsistent from hole to hole on the same course. Chipping is a freaking nightmare. If you have to hit a ball anywhere from 10-20 yards off the green, it's a literal crap shoot. What might send a ball 3 yards this time, might send it all the way across a flat green the next time. The wind is also a nightmare. A side wind of 10mph might send a perfectly hit shot 30 yards off course one hole, and the same wind won't effect the next tee shot at all. Another big con is that everyone plays with the exact same clubs; there is no variation, no upgrades, no individual style. Unfortunatley, there isn't much else to choose from in the world of golf games, and so I will continue to be frustrated playing this one for now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At this time, unless they improve the keyboard and mouse controls for the game, I have to advise everybody that is going to want to play with keyboard and mouse to steer a wide berth around this dud.

Also make sure that you have a computer similar to those used to launch the space shuttles at Nasa as it's a major lag monster.  Even turning down the limited settings to low only results in 15 frames per second.

As this is early access, I expect frame rates to be rough, but being that this is a PC game I expect full mouse and keyboard control to be included in the game BEFORE it is released as early access game.

If they improve performance, and include proper keyboard and mouse control then I'll think about changing my review of the game.  But as it stands now, today, in early access....

3 out of 10 stars.

P.S. I can not explain why it says that I hae 0 hours played on this title, I have more than that, it's either a bug in Steam or perhaps having to exit the game using the X in the window corner prevents it from logging my time, i don't know, but I do have some time on this game although nothing substantial due to the poor keyboard and mouse controls and the terrible performance.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Huge mistake.  From playing I could immediately tell this was awful.  Using the mouse is like emulating an analog stick.  This is a straight console game, not even a port.  It's like a badly emulated console game.  Absolutely impossible to get any feel.  When you start to pull down on the mouse for backswing, your player has a delayed reaction, same with the downswing.  If you want to hit a 50% shot, good effing luck.  Putting is basically impossible since there's no feel and so much lag between what you do with your mouse and your characters animations on the screen.

I immediately regretted my decision to buy this.  Should have just dug up my copy of Tiger Woods Golf 2008 or whatever year it was before EA messed it up.  Strong do not buy unless you like supporting console ports that are worse than your average Ubisoft port.  Honestly, on second thought, I'd rather play a game that has Uplay than play this piece of crap again.

reviewText:
Updated Review:
After some tweaks to the controls, and wind (it seems to me at least), I am turning my prior thumbs down, to up.  While the current PC controls are still more difficult to master, they seem to have reached a nice balance that is a reasonable compromise.  I'm glad to see that the devs were able to get things fixed up.


Previous Review:
If I were to have written this review a month ago I would have said nothing but positive things, but after the last update, I can't recommend The Golf Club at all.  Controls (I'm on a PC with a mouse) are distasterous to me.  Others seem to share my frustration while some have adapted to the changes.  They increased the wind factor and it seems every game has outrageous wind.  It's not adjustable at the user level (that I know of).

It's a strange thing when an early access game gets worse with time.  Maybe it'll straighten out - if so, I'll try to come back and update this, but for now:  Thumbs Down.
