reviewText:
Has potential and will keep trying it now and again but it is unplayable as a PC golf game.  It has the absolutely worst mouse swing mechanics ever.  It is not responsive and spongy.  There is such a delay that you don;t know if it started to register your swing or not.  Putting is a joke as there is no feel for the putt and that mouse swing mechanic means that you will have no idea if your swing is registered until it's too late.

It looks nice, though it seems to require a NASA computer if you want any bumped up graphics at all.

I'll keep playing it though, but it seems I get halfway through a round and give up because of the lousy swing mechanics (guess I am just wishing this would bring back that Links feel).

(edit 4/18/15) - They have improved the puting as it now responds much better than the move the mouse and hope for the best approach initially.  Though I am having major issues with power for the other shots, seems like no matter how lighly I have moved the mouse forward when I don't want full power the shot still ends up being 90% or higher.  I can now tell the difference in force used for putting but it seems other shots don't have the same level of sensitivity.  I really suck at the game, which is okay, but I still don't feel comfortable recommending it yet.

The other issue that is more than a minor issue is that several times I have pulled back to start the shot, the player starts his backswing, I then complete my shot pushing forward and the player never shoots, he just re-addresses the ball.  Have had that happen multiple times and it is rather annoying as by about the 4th time you try swinging you really are just frustrated that the other swings didn't take and are bound to have a bad shot.

(edit 8/16/15) - I have given up trying to use the mouse swing.  I have started to play using the controller and for a controller based game it is pretty decent.  I wish the mouse swing could be improved, that still has no feel at all, like guessing on every shot.  Still not sure if I can recommend it as a PC golf game, it's more like a console port.

(edit:  8/18/15) - Starting to like the game now that I have given myself up to using a controller.  It is really growing on me.  This may become a recommend soon.  Wish there was a neutral option.

(edit: 10/25/15) - I have changed this to a thumbs up.  While I seriously wish the mouse swing worked better, using the x-box 360 controller works quite well.  I still suck at the game itself but have found it enjoyable.  Using the controller I feel a better level of control of my swing and the graphics are good (though I have my settings turned down as it requires more power than I have to crank them up.  I recommend this only if you don't mind using a controller.  If you want to use a mouse swing, I would avoid the frustration.

Original Review (November 2014):
This game is not bad
column17: but definitely didn't live up to the hype. The lack of a career mode with depth features is a let-down
column18: and the limited amount of character customization is one even more so. Also
column19: it would have been cool to have some sort of earnings system or something of the like that integrates with a career mode to give it long-term replay value. Also
column20: the lack of online multiplayer features is a bit frustrating.\n\nMechanics - keyboard and mouse gameplay is really
column21: really not enjoyable once you have tried it with a controller. You will notice a ridiculous difference in your accuracy when using a controller joystick over a mouse for swinging.\n\nAll that being said
column23: and almost feels like the main attraction of the game. If you want to design a virtual golf course and have the time and imagination to devote to it
column24: this game is for you. The course designer has a lot of options and - I would imagine - is unmatched in its genre in the scope of this feature. Also
column25: the gameplay is not bad at all
column26: but can be quirky. The commentary is really just downright annoying and repetitive after a while.\n\nOverall
column27: if you are not big into golf games
column28: avoid it. It's really unbalanced and does not have enough of the career and online features to attract a wide scope of gamers. If you are interested in designing elaborate and realistic looking golf courses and playing them for fun
column29: it could be worth the 35 bucks
column30: but I would honestly wait until there's a drop in price or a sale to consider it even if that is your MO."
